description: From Middle English diligent, from Old French diligent, from Latin dīligēns (“careful, attentive, diligent”), present participle of dīligō (“to love, esteem much, literally to choose, select”), from dī-, dis- (“apart”) + legō (“to choose”); see elect and select.

adjectives.description: diligent (comparative more diligent, superlative most diligent)

entries.meaning: Performing with industrious concentration; hard-working and focused.
examples: Scientists are very diligent in their work.
